instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop no chime
threads.message:
Got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thats so very nearly posting, But just as it initialises RAM the machine turns off and starts again. The CPU core drops to 0.8V as it should just before post.
It had a tiny amount of liquid damage near the SPI, but ive reflashed it and no difference was noted. If the ram is removed the system remains on and gives a single beep.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop no chime
threads.message: Is this with or without an LCD connected?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop no chime
threads.message: Issue is without the LCD connected, board out, no peripherals connected/ board only.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop no chime
threads.message: Could be many things. Check corrosion under SMC/PCH and around clock chip.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop no chime
threads.message: Ive checked all of that, No signs of corrosion, i ultrasonic-ed it, no change, ive now reflown the SMC and PCH, again no change.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop no chime
threads.message: I would look around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and the FETs. AXG voltage coming on too?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop no chime
threads.message:
Missing <RESISTOR>R7554</RESISTOR>, Assume some moron had ripped it clean off, not something i was looking out for.
Solved, Thanks Duke
